content.description: Unsure if this lines goes. I started by gaining a RH crimp in the middle of the face and a LH on the arete. Use some smearing and old school technique to top. The arete holds disappear towards the top. To the right is another v6 slab that has seen some breaking and also probably does not go.
content.location: Left side of the Mini-Half Dome.

content.description: Start on the same jug rail as Road to Damascus and move slightly right to sharp crimps and exit early doing a heinous pull over the giant foot using small crystals.
content.location: The back side of Mini Half-Dome. Start at the same jug rail as 'Road to Damascus'

content.description: Start on the obvious jug rail on the left side of boulder. Pull right through sharp crimps and slopers on the lip to a difficult mantle on the right side of the boulder. Foot lead for style points.
content.location: The backside of the Mini Half-Dome boulder, directly across from the Enormous boulder.

content.description: Old Spice is the curving lip of the clean, overhanging shield of rock on the uphill side of Felch boulder. Start off a small boulder at a fat pinch and surf the lip to an intimate topout.

A pair of moderately sized blocks on the hill to the east of the gully. Old Spice is on the former and is a true hidden gem. The latter is named for its passing resemblance to a famous trad crag and has a classic hard slab problem.
